meanings.definition: A group of naturally occurring alcohols found in essential oils.
meanings.sent1: The farnesols in the oil give it a pleasant smell.
meanings.sent2: Perfumers often use farnesols to create floral scents.
meanings.sent3: The farnesols in the air made the room smell like a garden.
meanings.sent4: Her perfume was so strong, it seemed like farnesols were dancing around her.
meanings.sent5: The farnesols added a touch of nature to the fragrance.

meanings.definition: Compounds with a floral scent commonly used in perfumery.
meanings.sent1: The farnesols in this perfume remind me of a blooming garden.
meanings.sent2: Many people love the sweet aroma of farnesols in perfumes.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the farnesols in the air made her sneeze flowers.
meanings.sent4: The farnesols floated in the room like fragrant petals.
meanings.sent5: The farnesols filled the room with the scent of fresh flowers.

meanings.definition: Chemical compounds with potential antimicrobial properties.
meanings.sent1: Researchers are studying the farnesols for their ability to fight germs.
meanings.sent2: Hospitals may use farnesols to keep surfaces clean and safe.
meanings.sent3: The farnesols were like tiny soldiers battling against bacteria.
meanings.sent4: In the lab, the farnesols showed promise in killing harmful microbes.
meanings.sent5: The farnesols acted as a shield against harmful pathogens.
